page.title: 15RAILWAY TRAFFIC
page.content: In common with most other routes in South-East England,traffic has been mainly passenger. There has always been a through service to London (Charing Cross) which was not very frequent in the days of steam,but which became 2 trains per hour when electrified in 1961. Today there are 24 services a day in each direction between London and Sandwich. All these stop at Martin Mill. There has been some general goods traffic and the development of the Kent coalfield led to some of the coal from Betteshanger colliery using the line to Dover docks and London. With the recent decline of coal less freight is carried. During the Second World War a 13.5 inch railway gun ,named Gladiator,and one of three in the area was stationed at Martin Mill. It hid from enemy fire in Guston Tunnel.
